sentences.sContent: This is an actual monster, some sort of rodent-like creature with a dinosaur beak.
sentences.sContent_eng: This is an actual monster, some sort of rodent-like creature with a dinosaur beak.
sentences.sCn: 这真的是怪兽，有点像啮齿动物，但长着恐龙一样的嘴巴。

sentences.sContent: But the new  study found that 70 percent of rodent and primate groups have species with an appendix.
sentences.sContent_eng: But the new study found that 70 percent of rodent and primate groups have species with an appendix.
sentences.sCn: 但是，这项新的研究发现，70%的啮齿动物和灵长目动物的物种具有阑尾。

sentences.sContent: Like Plasmodium, which cycles between mosquitoes and man, Toxoplasma cycles between its rodent and feline hosts, living out different phases of its existence in each.
sentences.sContent_eng: Like Plasmodium, which cycles between mosquitoes and man, Toxoplasma cycles between its rodent and feline hosts, living out different phases of its existence in each.
sentences.sCn: 像疟原虫在蚊子和人之间循环一样，弓形虫的循环界于其啮齿类和猫科宿主之间，在不同宿主体内活出不同的生存阶段。

synos.tran: [脊椎]啮齿类的；咬的，嚼的；侵蚀性的

remMethod.val: rod(咬) + ent → 喜欢咬的动物 → 啮齿类动物

trans.tranCn: 啮齿类的；咬的，嚼的；侵蚀性的

trans.tranOther: any small animal of the type that has long sharp front teeth, such as a rat or a rabbit
